## A conjecture Let us now suppose: * A population $N$ consists of a set of voters. * Each voter $i \in N$ has utility for a candidate that is determined -- up to tie breaking -- by function $U_i(X_1, X_2, ..., X_n)$ for attributes $X_1, X_2, ..., X_n$. No external features affect utility and voter specific-features are captured in the subscript on $U$. * There is a distribution of *possible candidates* in an election ```{r} library(CausalQueries) library(latex2exp) make_model("Corruption -> Efficacy -> Utility <- Integrity <- Corruption") |> plot_model(textcol = "black", nodecol = "white") ``` There is a $$ \text{AMCE}_{X_1} = \sum_{x_2, x_1', x_2'} \Big[ Y\big((1, x_2), (x_1', x_2')\big) - Y\big((0, x_2), (x_1', x_2')\big) \Big] \, p(x_2, x_1', x_2'). $$ The ATE is $$ \text{ATE}_{X_1} = \mathbb{E}\left[ \sum_{x_1', x_2'} \Big[ Y\big((1, x_2(1)), (x_1', x_2')\big) - Y\big((0, x_2(0)), (x_1', x_2')\big) \Big] \, p(x_1', x_2')\right]. $$
